intro: Leandra maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's leandra, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has elliptical, glossy leaves. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
